Generate 40-50 high-quality flashcards on 'Account Naming Conventions' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Asset Security > Asset Provisioning > Identity and Access Provisioning > User Account Provisioning > Account Naming Conventions). **Incorporate these exactly:** - Learning Objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] - Active Learning: Use discussion/problem-solving scenarios in explanations. - Scaffolding: [INSERT FULL SCAFFOLDING FROM ABOVE, including Prior Knowledge, Big Picture, Layers 1-4]. Research Context: Complete NIST SP 800-53 details (AC-2: Account Management - automate provisioning/monitoring; AC-3: Access Enforcement; IA-2: Identification); Sources: NIST SP 800-53r5 (https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-53r5.pdf), NIST SP 800-63 (https://pages.nist.gov/800-63-3/), CIS Controls v8 Control 5 (https://www.cisecurity.org/controls/cis-controls-list). **Output Format (JSON array of flashcards):** Each flashcard as object per schema: { "front": "Question", "back": { "answer": "...", "explanation": "... (cite NIST/sources, link to objectives/layers/active learning)", "bloom_level": "...", "scaffolding_layer": "...", "hints": ["...","..."], "related_objectives": [1,3] } } **Schema & Distractors:** Strictly follow [INSERT FULL FLASHCARD SCHEMA FROM ABOVE]. Ensure distractors are educationally valuable (teach misconceptions). Balance: 10 Layer1/REMEMBER-UNDERSTAND, 15 Layer2-3/APPLY-ANALYZE, 15 Layer4/EVALUATE-CREATE, 10 integration/active scenarios.
